title: Soda, sugar-sweetened beverages linked to more severe symptoms for people with multiple sclerosis

title_detail.value: Soda, sugar-sweetened beverages linked to more severe symptoms for people with multiple sclerosis

summary: For people with multiple sclerosis (MS), drinking around 290 calories per day of soda or other sugar-sweetened beverages, or the equivalent of about two cans of non-diet soda, may be tied to more severe symptoms and a higher level of disability compared to people with MS who seldom consume sugar-sweetened beverages, according to a preliminary study.
